title: Morgan Stanley values Tyro Payments at up to $2.1b
text:
first published at 8.05am

Oct 31, 2019 — 9.09am , first published at 8.05am

Updated Oct 31, 2019 — 9.09am , first published at 8.05am

Morgan Stanley analysts have weighed into the Tyro Payments valuation debate, saying the company should be worth $1.5 billion to $2.1 billion.

The numbers were contained in initial public offering analyst reports sent to fund managers on Thursday morning.

Mike Cannon-Brookes is one of Tyro Payments' biggest investors. Steven Siewert

The range represented 6.25-times to 8.7-times forecast sales.

Morgan Stanley's analysts used a discounted cash flow valuation methodology with an 8 per cent weighted average cost of capital.

The analysts compared Tyro Payments to three baskets of stocks; global payments companies, domestic high growth names and mature platform businesses like REA and SEEK.
description: Morgan Stanley analysts have weighed into the Tyro Payments valuation debate, saying the company should be worth $1.5 billion to $2.1 billion.
